details: Faculty of Mathematics, Physics and Informatics

aboutMe: I started programming as a freshman in high school. The turning point came when I entered the Zenit competition in programming and later the Olympiad in Informatics.

I programmed in Python, but gradually started using C++ as competitions started to demand it. During the lockdown period I also learned to program in JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML and CSS. In college, I learned how to program in Java and GO, and improved my skill in Python, C++, JS.
It is because of these experiences that I know myself to be a fast learner and adapt quickly in a new environment.

experience.popupDetailsText:
In SmartBase s.r.o I worked as a Junior developer on various projects s.a. <some websites>.

At first I only worked on frontend, html, css and javascript related tasks. But after first month I got to work on various tasks on backend as well. i.e. I worked on tasks s.a. integrating payment API or fixing bug with loading very high quality pictures when not necessary over mobile data.

I learned a lot and they were quite nice to me. But I unfortunately didn't have time to work enough hours because of school.

During the summer of 2020, I worked part-time at Azteka delivering pizzas.

This role helped me develop time management and customer service skills. It was a great way to understand local businesses and interact with a diverse range of people.

achievements.introText: Since the 5th grade of primary school I have regularly placed in the top positions in various mathematical competitions (e.g. Math Olympiad, Math Kangaroo (Matematický klokan) or Pythagoriad (Pytagoriáda)). Thanks to a good foundation in mathematics, I learned to program and solve algorithmic problems very quickly and easily, which is why I started to compete in programming as well.
